name: uncongenial
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a person) not friendly and pleasant: Unfortunately I found him almost as uncongenial as his sister.
(of an activity or place) not enjoyable, acceptable, or welcoming: He found post-war college life uncongenial, and after two terms decided that it would be better to earn a living. My liking for a bargain enables me to overlook uncongenial retail surroundings.
not helpful; not likely to make something successful, or to provide the right conditions for something to happen or exist: In this period the religious climate proved uncongenial to such ideas.
More examplesFewer examplesHe proved himself a capable, if somewhat uncongenial, manager of men.If we find the rules of a particular activity uncongenial or impossible to keep, we can, at least in principle, contract out and play a different game.A career in commerce proved uncongenial, so he entered the General Baptist/Unitarian ministry.Space scientists theorise the existence of a virtually unlimited array of other planetary environments, almost all of which are uncongenial to human life.
